reviews.text: I think I should have read previous reviews before booking here. I am afraid that the first impressions of this hotel were very poor in terms of service and standards. I had booked a 2 night Dr Who package in one of the "deluxe rooms". The website made the package seem very good value for money but on arrival none of the advertised "package" was in the room even though I asked the receptionist on check in if it was. I had 2 excited children who were expecting their Dr Who items to be waiting in the room for them. The room was booked for 2 adults and 2 children but only had towels and cups for 2. The "deluxe" room had no bathrobe, no wine, no shower gel, no milk. There was a hole in the sheet in one of the beds and the shower curtain was filthy. My husband complained to the receptionist and to the credit of the staff all of the issues were rectified within an hour. My concern is that the room should have been clean and the advertised items available before we checked in.
reviews.title: A very poor first impression

likes.disliked: — cleanliness of room, advertised facilities not in room

reviews.text: On the plus side the swimming pool was very nice although my husband said the mens changing room was a bit grim. We had breakfast on both mornings and the food and service were very good. The evening meal for the first night was included in the package and was not bad. Our waiter Sean was very polite and attentive.
reviews.title: Variable?

reviews.text: I would not chose to stay at this hotel again as I think the poor first impression will make me chose another hotel in Newport.

reviews.text: Perhaps mixed reviews result from variable levels of service: at busy periods it seems staff could not perform to satisfactory standards, that one would normally expect from Hilton? Our stay in April was a mixed experience: some tired furnishings did not impress, in one bedroom a large cobweb suggested lack of attention to cleaning routines, and at breakfast having to ask three or four times for tea/coffee an inexcusable lapse of service (the problem appeared to be mainly at supervisory level, perhaps because of having to cope with many guests?).

reviews.text: Oh Dear. To be fair, my experience of this hotel was probably not as bad as some, but it was not very good either. I was booked into the hotel by the travel agent my company uses and I had no choice in the matter as there was a conference there the following day. Having read the reviews on trip adviser I was very apprehensive about my visit and if I'd been paying, no way would I have gone there. I visited in December and it was cold. The room was cold, but fortuntately I had taken my hot water bottle. I had the controlable electric heater on full blast all night. The room was very large, so it was not very effective. The next morning the wall paper was black from the heat! The windows were mouldy, the carpet in the area with the sink shabby, mould on the bathroom fittings. The telephone was dirty and room had no atmoshpere or ambiance. The bed was comfortable though and I did get a good night's sleep! The breakfast was good - everything you could wish for. But on the whole, I'd give it a miss. In fact, I'd give Newport a miss unless you have to go there. It has little to recommend it.
reviews.title: Oh Dear

description: Located at the gateway between England and Wales, the Hilton Newport hotel is close to glorious Welsh countryside and is situated just off the M4 motorway at Junction 24 and 3 miles from Newport City Centre. Explore nearby Newport attractions, before enjoying hearty British cuisine at the contemporary Seasons Restaurant. Relax over a coffee at Costa Coffee or enjoy a glass of wine on the patio of the Court Bar & Lounge. Enjoy the hotel's Livingwell Health Club with its 18 metre indoor pool and air conditioned gym or maybe make time for a beauty treatment or two with the Essence of Beauty. Car parking charges apply.60 minutes free wifi available in Court Lounge and Court Bar.
